Package fr.i360matt.fastmongo

Class Element

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.i360matt.fastmongo.Element
  • public final class Element
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing and managing an object from the collection
    Author:
    360matt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.lang.String id  
      CollectionManager manager  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Element​(java.lang.String id, CollectionManager manager)
      Allows to create an editing reference for a document (whether or not it is fictitious) so that the final document can be manipulated

    • Constructor Detail

      • Element

        public Element​(java.lang.String id,
               CollectionManager manager)
        Allows to create an editing reference for a document (whether or not it is fictitious) so that the final document can be manipulated
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the document you want to represent
        manager - The manager of the collection where the document is supposed to be located (whether it exists or not)

      • increment

        public final void increment​(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        Allows to increment [or decrement] a field. The negative value will result in a decrement.
        Parameters:
        key - name of the field.
        value - increment value, can be negative to reverse for a decrement

      • increment

        public final void increment​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> values)
        Allows to increment [or decrement] several fields in a request thanks to a Map. Negative values will result in decrementations
        Parameters:
        values - field / value pair [increment / decrement]

      • increment

        public final void increment​(java.lang.Object... values)
        Allows to increment [or decrement] several fields in a query thanks to a variadic argument Two consecutive values match a pair key -> value Negative values will result in decrementations
        Parameters:
        values - field / value pair [increment / decrement]
